Power on the device with USB cable,If it is in first time use, the blue Wi-Fi LED will flash rapidly (about 2-3 times per second)indicating the device is in configuration mode (waiting to be added into network). The LED indicator is in other states? Input the correct password and tap here to configure Please enter the Wi-Fi name Please enter Wi-Fi password Change Wi-Fi Please connect to the previous WiFi Now you are connected to a hidden network. This smart plug will be connected to: Please select timer if you are not sure You can re-configure the device in "Device list" Please enter the name Please choose an icon Configure %1$s Enter device list No device was found. \nPlease check indicator state of device: \nFlash quickly:Tap "Configure" button. \nFlash slowly: Reset device. \nOff: Check the device list. Device configuration list Devices to be configured Device reset I have reset the device Reset your universal Remote by pressing and holding the reset button (as shown in figure) through a slim needle for not less than 6s until the blue LED indicator flashes rapidly (about 2-3 times per second) Cannot find the device to be added Please confirm:\n1) If the device is in configuration mode\n2) If your Wi-Fi network is 2.4G (5G is not supported) Contact Customer Service Try other methods Add device by WIFI Insert the "reset" hole on the left side of the power port (position as shown) and hold for about 5 seconds until the indicator lights become flash. Perform reset operation again until the indicator lights are in a state of intermittent slow flashing. Access to device Wi-Fi hotspot mode. Slide up and down to select the type of appliance to be connected Tap here to choose a room for the device Each cycle must be shorter than the entire time frame Now Timer History Night light Current state Current power Consumption of this month Cost of this month Delay timer Scheduled timer Add timer Device time Room WeChat control Standby saving TOU Firmware update Random timer Cycled timer Lap timer The timer should be set later than current time You are allowed to add only 1 delay timer You are allowed to add %1$s scheduled timers You are allowed to add %1$s lap timers You are allowed to add 1 random timers You are allowed to add 1 cycled timers Lap Repeated Random The time lap cannot be less than 20 minutes. Night light ON OFF Type of timer Scheduled timer will be activated at specified time while delay timer will be activated after specified period.

The smart plug will cut off the power if the connected appliance is in standby state to save power consumption. It needs to measure standby power of appliance before enabling standby saving Measure standby power Standby state Switch the appliance to standby state 1. Make sure the appliance is working and turn off the appliance by pressing the power button.\ n2. Please refer to the manual of appliance if you are not sure what is the standby state.\ n3. Contact your local technical support to get help. Appliance is in standby state Standby power Tap to measure again

Ihc needs the following permissions to provide you with a complete service Location permissions Set the home location to get device list and more Phone permissions Verify IMEI & IMSI code to prevent account theft Camera permissions Used to scan product barcodes and add device Storage authority Save home data locally Microphone (recording) authority Voice control via microphone Address Book permissions Get account information to meet device push service

What worth buying
Select type of remote Please select the type of remote for your appliance IR remote You can find LED bead or black lens at the head of remote and you need to point the remote towards appliance when you control it. RF remote There is no LED bead or black lens on remote (some maybe with antenna) and you do not need to point the remote towards appliance when you control it. Bead Lens No bead or lens External antenna Please refer to user manual if you cannot identify the type of remote Matching remote Please keep your remote closed to Wi-Fi universal remote and press and hold any button on remote press and hold Matching successful Matching failed 1. Please keep your remote closed to Wi-Fi universal remote\n2. Please press and hold any button on remote during matching\n3. Please make sure your remote is RF type, otherwise please 1.
